                                                                       –3–                                         M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                                        Notes                   Total
1.     a    i    molar mass of urea « 4  1.01  2  14.01  12.01  16.00»  60.07 «g mol1» ✔ Award [2] for correct final answer.
                               2  14.01                                                         Award [1 max] for final answer not to
                 «% nitrogen            100 » 46.65 «%» ✔                                    two decimal places.                         2
                                 60.07


1.     a    ii   «cost» increases AND lower N % «means higher cost of transportation per unit of   Accept other reasonable explanations.
                 nitrogen»
                                                                                                   Do not accept answers referring to
                 OR                                                                                safety/explosions.                        1

                 «cost» increases AND inefficient/too much/about half mass not nitrogen ✔

1.     b                               Electron geometry          Molecular geometry               Note: Urea’s structure is more complex
                                                                                                   than that predicted from VSEPR theory.
                         Nitrogen         tetrahedral ✔           trigonal pyramidal ✔                                                       3
                          Carbon        trigonal planar ✔            trigonal planar

1.     c         n(KNCO) « 0.0500 dm3  0.100 mol dm3»  5.00  103 «mol» ✔                     Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                                                                             2
                 «mass of urea  5.00  103 mol  60.07 g mol1»  0.300 «g» ✔

1.     d         «Kc» decreases AND reaction is exothermic
                 OR
                 «Kc» decreases AND H is negative                                                                                           1
                 OR
                 «Kc» decreases AND reverse/endothermic reaction is favoured ✔
                                                                       –4–                        M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                       Notes                    Total
1.     e    i    Any one of:                                                     Accept “urea has larger size/greater
                                                                                 van der Waals forces”.
                 urea has greater molar mass ✔
                                                                                 Do not accept “urea has greater
                 urea has greater electron density/greater London/dispersion ✔   intermolecular forces/IMF”.                1
                 urea has more hydrogen bonding ✔
                 urea is more polar/has greater dipole moment ✔

1.     e    ii                                                                   Award [1] for each correct interaction.
                                                                                 If lone pairs are shown on N or O, then
                                                                                 the lone pair on N or one of the lone
                        ✔                                                        pairs on O MUST be involved in the
                                                                                 H-bond.
                               ✔                                                 Penalize solid line to represent           2
                                                                                 H-bonding only once.




1.     f         2(H2N)2CO (s)  3O2 (g)  4H2O (l)  2CO2 (g)  2N2 (g)         Accept (H2N)2CO (s) 
                                                                                                          3
                                                                                                              O2 (g) 
                                                                                                          2
                 correct coefficients on LHS ✔                                                                              2
                                                                                 2H2O (l)  CO2 (g)  N2 (g).
                 correct coefficients on RHS ✔
                                                                                 Accept any correct ratio.
                                             –5–                   M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                      Answers                         Notes                 Total
1.     g        60: CON2H4 ✔                      Accept “molecular ion”.
                44: CONH2 ✔
                                                                                          2



1.     h        3450 cm1: NH ✔                   Do not accept “OH” for 3450 cm–1.
                                                                                          2
                1700 cm1: CO ✔

1.     i        1✔                                                                        1
                                                                          –6–                   M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                        Answers                                     Notes                  Total
2.     a         electrostatic attraction AND oppositely charged ions ✔                                                  1

2.     b         1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6
                 OR                                                                                                      1
                 [Ar] ✔

2.     c         «promoted» electrons fall back to lower energy level ✔         Accept “Na and Ca have different
                                                                                nuclear charge” for M2.                  2
                 energy difference between levels is different ✔

2.     d    i    Any two of:
                 stronger metallic bonding ✔
                 smaller ionic/atomic radius ✔


                 two electrons per atom are delocalized
                                                                                                                         2
                 OR
                 greater ionic charge ✔
                                                                                Do not accept just “heavier” or “more
                                                                                massive” without reference to atomic
                 greater atomic mass ✔
                                                                                mass.

2.     d    ii   delocalized/mobile electrons «free to move» ✔                                                           1

2.     e         pH > 7 ✔                                                       Accept any specific pH value or range
                                                                                of values above 7 and below 14.          1
                                                                      –7–                               M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                             Notes                       Total
3.     a    i    nickel/Ni «catalyst» ✔                                                Accept these other catalysts: Pt, Pd, Ir,
                                                                                       Rh, Co, Ti.

                 high pressure                                                                                                        2
                                                                                       Accept “high temperature” or a stated
                 OR
                                                                                       temperature such as “150 ºC”.
                 heat ✔

3.     a    ii                                                                         Ignore square brackets and “n”.
                                                                                       Connecting line at end of carbons
                                                                                       must be shown.                                 1
                                                   ✔


3.     b    i    H Ö  bonds broken  bonds formed ✔                                  Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                       Award [1 max] for +525 «kJ»
                 «H Ö  3(C~C)  6(C C)benzene / 3  839  6  507 / 2517  3042 »
                 525 «kJ» ✔
                                                                                       Award [1 max] for:                             2
                                                                                       «H Ö  3(CC)  3(CC)  3(CC) /
                                                                                       3  839  3  346  3  614 / 2517 
                                                                                       2880 » 363 «kJ».

3.     b    ii   H Ö  Hf (products)  Hf (reactants) ✔                           Award [2] for correct final answer.
                                                                                       Award [1 max] for “+635 «kJ»”.                 2
                 «H Ö  49 kJ  3  228 kJ » 635 «kJ» ✔

(Question 3b continued)

      Question                                         Answers                                            Notes                Total
 3.     b    iii   Hf values are specific to the compound
                   OR
                   bond enthalpy values are averages «from many different compounds» ✔
                                                                                                                                2
                                                                                         Accept “benzene is in two different
                   condensation from gas to liquid is exothermic ✔
                                                                                         states «one liquid the other gas»“
                                                                                        for M2.

 3.     c          equal CC bond «lengths/strengths»                                    Accept “all C–C–C bond angles are
                                                                                         equal”.
                   OR
                   regular hexagon
                   OR                                                                                                           1
                   «all» CC have» bond order of 1.5
                   OR
                   «all» CC intermediate between single and double bonds ✔

 3.     d          electrophilic substitution
                   OR                                                                                                           1
                   SE ✔
                                                                          –9–                                          M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                          Notes                Total
4.     a         Any two of:                                                                         Do not accept “disappearance of
                                                                                                     calcium carbonate”.
                 loss of mass «of reaction mixture/CO2» ✔
                                                                                                     Do not accept “gas bubbles”.
                 «increase in» volume of gas produced ✔
                                                                                                     Do not accept “colour change” or         2
                 change of conductivity ✔                                                            “indicator”.
                 change of pH ✔
                 change in temperature ✔

4.     b    i    reaction is fast at high concentration AND may be difficult to measure accurately
                 OR
                 so many bubbles of CO2 produced that inhibit contact of HCl (aq) with CaCO3 (s)
                 OR
                 insufficient change in conductivity/pH at high concentrations
                 OR
                                                                                                                                              1
                 calcium carbonate has been used up/is limiting reagent/there is not enough
                 calcium carbonate «to react with the high concentration of HCl»
                 OR
                 HCl is in excess
                 OR
                 so many bubbles of CO2 produced that inhibit contact of HCl (aq) with CaCO3 (s) ✔

4.     b    ii   «directly» proportional ✔                                                           Accept “first order” or “linear”.
                                                                                                     Do not accept “rate increases as
                                                                                                                                              1
                                                                                                     concentration increases” or “positive
                                                                                                     correlation”.
                                                                      – 10 –                  M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                            Answers                               Notes                   Total
5.     a        slower rate with ethanoic acid                                 Accept experimental observations such
                OR                                                             as “slower bubbling” or “feels less
                                                                               warm”.
                smaller temperature rise with ethanoic acid ✔


                [H] lower                                                                                              2
                OR
                ethanoic acid is partially dissociated
                OR
                ethanoic acid is weak ✔

5.     b        Any one of:                                                    Accept “lowering pH of
                                                                               oceans/lakes/waterways”.
                corrosion of materials/metals/carbonate materials ✔
                                                                                                                        1
                destruction of plant/aquatic life ✔
                «indirect» effect on human health ✔
                                                                  – 11 –                   M18/4/CHEMI/SP2/ENG/TZ1/XX/M


     Question                                           Answers                            Notes                  Total
6.     a        salt bridge ✔


                movement of ions                                                                                   2
                                                                           Do not accept “to complete circuit”
                OR
                                                                           unless ion movement is mentioned for
                balance charge ✔                                           M2.

6.     b        Positive electrode (cathode):                              Award [1 max] if correct equations
                                                                           given at wrong electrodes.
                Ag (aq)  e  Ag (s) ✔
                                                                                                                   2
                Negative electrode (anode):
                Mg (s)  Mg2 (aq)  2e ✔

6.     c        in external wire from left to right ✔                                                              1
